titleStmt.title: Letter from Alice Culler Neihardt to Enid Neihardt, July 26th 1929
titleStmt.author: Neihardt, Alice Culler

publicationStmt.authority: The Papers of John G. Neihardt

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Letter from Alice Culler Neihardt to Enid Neihardt, July 22nd 1929

msIdentifier.repository: John G. Neihardt Center Research Library, Aly Collection

div1.p: Your good letter to Daddy and me just same - I think you will always remember waht a nice since you had at Gran mas! This Summer. Too bad about Dolly! The endurance
flyers are - still up and they say they will make it 500 hours before they quit they won the record last Tuesday - so please let out 3 cheers for Sambert Field men and St. Louis! Famous Barr's store
have promised to give each pilot $100.00 a day that they remain up after the rest - so I think the men have figured it is the best way they ever had to make $100. so a day - and they
are remaining in the sky! Did you see Mr Kennemore? Tell Hilda she ought to read the Kite load and make a number of the kites - Daddy says he thinks Mr More
will help her. As I sit here; the perspira-tion is running down me like a shower-bath It is very, very lot, and so snuggy. Mrs Holson just now came - she said she had not gone to your gradu

ation because they had lot Jackie, and had been busting nearly all that after noon for him all over Kirkwood - when she finally found him they were too tired do any thing else! She is just the same and so nice.
Jack Wheeler is in Kansas City.- I got some for voice and Piano. I will love so pley with you.- Safer Sig is home and tying the "Evening Star" I'll go down and by my part.-

closer.note: After.........days, return to Neihardt 507 North Clay. KIRKWOOD, MO. I Miss Enid Neihardt Box 255 Branson, M
